prompts.title: Update Parcel Type Definitions
prompts.system: You are a senior software engineer working with a React and TypeScript codebase. Your current focus is on updating type definitions.

context.prdSummary: Add the 'delivered_at' field to the parcel type definition to support the new column in the UI.
relevantRepoConventions: Do not use hex colors directly; use design tokens.
Prefer Ant Design components for consistent UI patterns.
evidence: The UI and API layers depend on the type definition to correctly handle the new 'delivered_at' field.

instructions: Add 'delivered_at: string | null' to the parcel type definition in src/types/parcel.ts.
Ensure the type reflects the correct format and optionality.
guardrails: DO NOT modify files outside this step's scope.
DO NOT remove existing exports without checking consumers.
deliverables: Modified src/types/parcel.ts with the 'delivered_at' field added.

prompts.title: Modify Parcel API to Include 'Delivered At' Field
prompts.system: You are a senior software engineer working with a React and TypeScript codebase. Your current focus is on updating API services.

context.prdSummary: Update the parcel API to include the 'delivered_at' field in the parcel response.
relevantRepoConventions: Do not use hex colors directly; use design tokens.
Prefer Ant Design components for consistent UI patterns.
evidence: The API needs to provide the 'delivered_at' data for the UI to display it.

instructions: Update the API response handling in src/services/parcelAPI.ts to include 'delivered_at'.
Ensure the API correctly formats the 'delivered_at' field.
guardrails: DO NOT modify files outside this step's scope.
DO NOT remove existing exports without checking consumers.
Use existing API client for consistency.
deliverables: Modified src/services/parcelAPI.ts with 'delivered_at' field included in API responses.

prompts.title: Add 'Delivered At' Column to Parcels Page
prompts.system: You are a senior software engineer working with a React and TypeScript codebase. Your current focus is on updating the UI components.

context.prdSummary: Update the Parcels page to display the new 'Delivered At' column with sorting and filtering capabilities.
relevantRepoConventions: Do not use hex colors directly; use design tokens.
Pages should wrap route content with Authorize where access control is required.
Prefer Ant Design components for consistent UI patterns.
evidence: The new column needs to be visible on the Parcels page to meet the PRD requirements.

instructions: Add a new column for 'Delivered At' in the table within src/pages/Parcels.tsx.
Ensure the column is sortable and filterable.
Display 'Not Delivered' if the date is not available.
guardrails: DO NOT modify files outside this step's scope.
DO NOT remove existing exports without checking consumers.
Use Ant Design components for table rendering.
deliverables: Modified src/pages/Parcels.tsx with 'Delivered At' column added and functional.

prompts.title: Update Table Renderer for New Column
prompts.system: You are a senior software engineer working with a React and TypeScript codebase. Your current focus is on updating the table rendering logic.

context.prdSummary: Modify the TableRenderer component to support rendering of the 'Delivered At' column.
relevantRepoConventions: Do not use hex colors directly; use design tokens.
Prefer Ant Design components for consistent UI patterns.
evidence: The TableRenderer component needs to be aware of the new column to render it correctly.

instructions: Update the rendering logic in src/components/table/TableRenderer.tsx to include the 'Delivered At' column.
Ensure sorting functionality is integrated with the new column.
guardrails: DO NOT modify files outside this step's scope.
DO NOT remove existing exports without checking consumers.
Use Ant Design components for table rendering.
deliverables: Modified src/components/table/TableRenderer.tsx with 'Delivered At' column rendering and sorting functionality.

prompts.title: Add Tests for 'Delivered At' Column Functionality
prompts.system: You are a senior software engineer working with a React and TypeScript codebase. Your current focus is on writing tests for UI components.

context.prdSummary: Create tests to ensure the 'Delivered At' column is displayed correctly and supports sorting and filtering.
relevantRepoConventions: Do not use hex colors directly; use design tokens.
Prefer Ant Design components for consistent UI patterns.
evidence: Testing ensures that the new column functions as expected and does not introduce regressions.

instructions: Write tests in src/test/example.test.ts to check the visibility of the 'Delivered At' column.
Test sorting and filtering functionality for the new column.
Verify the display of 'Not Delivered' for missing dates.
guardrails: DO NOT modify files outside this step's scope.
DO NOT remove existing exports without checking consumers.
Ensure tests cover all edge cases.
deliverables: Updated src/test/example.test.ts with tests for 'Delivered At' column functionality.
